intro: Lallemantia canescens var. brachystegia, commonly known as the short-stemmed lallemantia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively low maintenance once established.
